is there are three kinds of tobacco smoke for the most part when a tobacco cigarette smoker generates smoke to inhale that's called mainstream smoke it's the tobacco smoke that's drawn through the butt end of a cigarette during active smoking usually a smoker will generate about 8 to 10 or 11 + / cigarette most of that is inhaled and it's inhale in a variety of different patterns and

I mean on the pattern of inhalation anywhere from 40 to 80 percent of though that or even more may be retained by the active smoker whatever's left and is not absorbed by the smoker or what's not evaporated out of the particles is then exhaled into the environment sidestream smoke is the tobacco smoke that's released into the surrounding environment from the smoldering tip of a burning cigarette between active Puffs and in terms of most of the smoke that can potentially get out into the environment
Aunt most of it comes from sidestream smoke

ETS or environmental tobacco smoke is the combination of Highly diluted sidestream Smoke Plus a smaller amount of mainstream smoke that is exhaled and not retained by the active smoker I've shown these in a sort of a schematic way and this diagram
